reviews.text: If you know London stations this is probably one of the better ones...easy access (escalator & lift) from platforms to ground level, feels reasonably safe in an otherwise dodgy area...trains, like most parts of the UK, are often buggered up at weekends...avoid, if can help it, after the pubs have just closed...

Not the biggest fan of this station despite it's good location and connection with local buses. The design is nice enough and there is step free access via lifts at least, however, the reliability of trains here is not exactly up to the expectations of the 1000s of people who ride on the service every day. I'm very fortunate that I'm not one of them.

When things are going well, you can get trains to Highbury & Islington, New Cross, Crystal Palace and West Croydon from here and they run quite frequently on this high demanding section.
Apart from changing lines at last minute and making everyone running like fools to the other side of the platform... its a nice place to avoid if you have a chance.
Not happy with my train being cancelled

Large, very spacious station. Always very clean and has a staff member around to help out. Has great links into the city, and a train at least every four or so minutes. Lots of space to store bikes inside and outside as well.
